title: Play Games in the Console
text: can install release version player CRAN : can install development version R-universe : GitHub :
code: install.packages("player") install.packages("player", repos = c("https://rossellhayes.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # install.packages("pak") pak::pkg_install("rossellhayes/player")

title: Play Games in the Console
text: player includes 10 games can player entirely within R console: Coin Flip Hangman Jumble Magic 8 Ball Poker Rock, Paper, Scissors Shut Box Spelling Bee 2048 Global Thermonuclear War Install package run player::play() get playing! Hex sticker image Flavia Rossell Hayes.

what: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
title: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
text: Look like working hard hardly working

title: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
code: look_busy(   minutes = if (rlang::is_interactive()) Inf else 0,   speed = 1,   lambda = 3,   background_job = FALSE,   end = invisible(NULL) )

title: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
text: minutes long keep . Defaults Inf, runs forever. speed fast produce output. default value, 1, takes 0.1 0.5 seconds produce calculation 1 5 seconds produce status update. lambda Input poisson distribution determining many calculations perform message. Defaults 3. background_job Whether produce output background job (TRUE) console (FALSE). Defaults FALSE. Running background process requires job package. end Code run minutes. minutes Inf, end never run.

title: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
text: end minutes finite.

title: Look like you're working hard when you're hardly working — look_busy
text: Alexander Rossell Hayes alexander@rossellhayes.com (ORCID) status messages contributed : Kristin Bott kristin.bott@posit.co Daniel Chen daniel.chen@posit.co (ORCID) Steven Smallberg steven.smallberg@posit.co

Flip a coin — play_coin_flip
text: Flip coin

title: Flip a coin — play_coin_flip
code: play_coin_flip(   n = NULL,   animate = rlang::is_interactive(),   header = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Flip a coin — play_coin_flip
text: n many coins flip. Defaults NULL, interactively asks many flip. animate TRUE, play animation revealing result. Defaults TRUE session interactive FALSE otherwise. header TRUE, prints header game. Defaults TRUE session interactive FALSE otherwise.

title: Flip a coin — play_coin_flip
text: character vector "heads" "tails" results.

Play a game of hangman in the console — play_hangman
text: default word list derived 12dicts created Alan Beale. word list passed Offensive/Profane Word List created Luis Von Ahn filter potentially unwanted words.

title: Play a game of hangman in the console — play_hangman
text: difficulty Determines length words used game , word_list NULL, common words word_list Optionally, character vector words used play game. unspecified, default word list used based difficulty.

title: Play a game of hangman in the console — play_hangman
text: Generates interactive output console.

title: Play a game of hangman in the console — play_hangman
text: can report words find objectionable https://github.com/rossellhayes/hangman/issues. Please report: offensive words words deal uncomfortable topics proper nouns text common English word

title: Play a game of hangman in the console — play_hangman
code: play_hangman()  play_hangman("beginner") play_hangman("easy") play_hangman("medium") play_hangman("hard") play_hangman("expert")  cars <- unique(gsub(" .*", "", rownames(mtcars))) play_hangman(word_list = cars)

title: Play a game of jumbles in the console — play_jumble
text: Difficulty levels defined follows: beginner: common English words 3 5 letters easy: common English words 4 6 letters medium: slightly less common English words 5 8 letters hard: somewhat less common English words 6 11 letters expert: less common English words 7 15 letters

title: Play five-card draw poker — play_poker
Play five-card draw poker — play_poker
text: colors One 1, 2, 4. number colors use render suits. 1, suits default console color. 2, hearts diamonds red spades clubs default console color. 4, hearts red, clubs green, diamonds blue, spades default console color.

title: Play five-card draw poker — play_poker
text: Generates interactive game poker console.

title: Play five-card draw poker — play_poker
text: straights, aces may considered highest card (king) lowest card (two). However, aces may used connect king two (e.g. Q-K--2-3 straight).

what: Play a game of rock, paper, scissors in the console — play_rock_paper_scissors
title: Play a game of rock, paper, scissors in the console — play_rock_paper_scissors
text: Play game rock, paper, scissors console

title: Play a game of rock, paper, scissors in the console — play_rock_paper_scissors
code: play_rock_paper_scissors(   selection = c(NA, "rock", "paper", "scissors"),   predict = TRUE,   record_data = rlang::is_interactive(),   animate = rlang::is_interactive(),   header = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Play a game of rock, paper, scissors in the console — play_rock_paper_scissors
text: selection Whether throw rock, paper, scissors. Can abbreviated "r", "p", "s". Defaults NA, interactively asks throw. predict TRUE, computer player fits model past games predict throw try beat . record_data TRUE, save data game file. data used predictions predict TRUE. Defaults TRUE session interactive FALSE otherwise. animate TRUE, play "rock, paper, scissors, shoot!" animation revealing computer throw. Defaults TRUE session interactive FALSE otherwise. header TRUE, prints header game. Defaults TRUE session interactive FALSE otherwise.

title: Play a game of rock, paper, scissors in the console — play_rock_paper_scissors
code: play_rock_paper_scissors("rock") #>                                 Rock ✊   📄 Paper                                #>                                     You lose                                     #>         I predicted you would throw: 33% scissors, 33% paper, 33% rock.           if (rlang::is_interactive()) play_rock_paper_scissors()
